ResponsesInList.Title: Face-to-face registration listings changed to A-Z
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi @Dan, We've recently noticed that for workshop registrations, the format of the listings for those currently enrolled in a listed workshop has changed from the order in which registrations are received, to A-Z listings based on first name when viewing as admin user. As the formatting has changed to A-Z, it's now unclear whether the waitlist function would still be able to track next-in-line if someone registered cancels their registration. Therefore, if a workshop becomes full and several individuals are waitlisted, is the first waitlisted person still offered a position first? Does the waitlist function recognise a time-stamp of when people register to manage this, or is this new A-Z listing structure likely to impact the waitlist function for students? We look forward to your advice.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time Zone
ResponsesInList.Text: By default the sessions should all show in the user's own timezone, so if an event is scheduled in US Central Timezone for 10:00 AM, but the viewing users is in India, the viewer will see it as scheduled at 9:30 PM. I believe at the database level the data is stored as a unix timestamp.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Road map for F2F or contact to a development company selling a more advanced plugin?

ResponsesInList.Title: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I did a lot of search and found that there were some PHP code hack in the year of 2012 discussion. But later discussions are saying that Face-to-Face are meant to be for one session only registration. If someone wants to re-register for a future session, they would have to be marked as "No-show" for the session that they registered before. However, we have very large population of participants and very few people to actually watch the attendance. It would be hard to compare each person and mark people who didn't show up as no-show.  Is there a way to just open up the registration list to allow multiple signing up? Thanks!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I am also looking for a solution for this. Does anyone have the hack they can post here? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I've been using face-to-face for 11 years and the answer has been NO the whole time. Marking them anything will allow them to re-register. Just mark each session. If you don't care if they actually attend or not, mark everyone attended... And for the inevitable next question, (can we have a select all?) probably not. I've asked the question several times over the years and again, the answer has been no. But it sure would be nice. I've heard the original developers have taken f2f up several levels but I don't think the new code is available to the community (and, that might just be hearsay).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Melanie. As to marking them anything - I cannot see that option at the moment?? Finally do you know of any other booking systems that allow this in Moodle? Was looking at 'Booking', but I cannot actually test it on moodlebites cause it doesn't let me create a new account. Essentially we run a series of workshops at different times and we want students to be able to sign up to multple AND receive email confirmations and notifications. Any help much appreciated. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: If it does not give you the option to take attendance, the date is still in the future. You can only take attendance after the session begins. Back in '08, still in the days of 1.9...I did a bunch of research on something like this. I found nothing that has the functionality of f2f...attendance might be more what you're looking for...but I think it tracks more of a day to day thing and, again, requires marking. At my prior job, we customized f2f to add an attendance by id option. We all had magnetic strip ID badges that had our id numbers coded in, so we could connect a usb swiper (or use a keyboard with a swiper) and as people walked in, they could swipe for attendance. Or the teacher could type in their ID's manually. Or could copy the list of swipes and paste it in for additional sessions (we frequently had back to back classes and people were required to attend several on the same day). It was pretty slick. The guy who wrote the code said it wasn't too hard. But that was a code hack and I can't share it...I don't work there any longer and they a) stopped using moodle and b) were resistant to sharing (I don't know why, the director was like that. Didn't like Moodle or open source, liked secret squirrel, now he's paying over $50,000 a year for something that doesn't have the flexibility Moodle has).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Guest access to Face-to-Face not working
ResponsesInList.Text: Guests can access the course but they cannot access activities .  Of they are not enrolled in the class, the class won't have a way to track them.  I suppose you could override guest roles but that is not one I would recommend changing.  The point of requiring people to be students is to track what they are doing--guest access is not tracked, therefore having them participate is pointless...

If HR doesn't want them to use personal email then they need to make sure they have company emails.

ResponsesInList.Title: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have been configuring a face-to-face activity and have noticed that when I mark a learner as 'no show', then the activity is still being set as 'complete' for them. Is there any way to tie passing grade to completion in this activity type? Thanks, Bruce

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately not at this time. Partially attended gets recorded as a 50, fully attended as 100, and no show as a zero. Those are all grades, so completion is triggered for all of them. I usually recommend using grade restrictions on a later activity that has more robust completion options, such as feedback, to trigger course completion.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: How would I set course completion to only occur for example for a grade of 100%? I have several sessions that a learner can choose from, they only need to attend one fully to pass... Is that possible through grade book? If so, can you provide an example? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: Set a grade to pass and it won't give completion. So...step 1, must receive a grade (but not view, that can jack things up massively). Step 2: Grades, Gradebook setup, Edit/Edit settings for the F2F, Set your Grade to pass to 50 or 100 (whatever you expect). Save.  You might need to click Show more to see the Grade to pass.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: At least in my testing on the latest version of the plugin and Moodle 3.5 and 3.6 that will still mark the activity as complete, but completed (did not achieve pass grade). So if course completion is tied to activity completion that will still mark as complete despite the no show. In some plugins there is an option to restriction completion to a passing grade, but F2F doesn't support that. So in this use case I would set the required course grade to 75 or 100 for course completion rather than rely on activity completion, or if there are other activities I would use a grade restriction instead of an activity completion to restrict access to the later activities. Jeremy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
ResponsesInList.Text: F2F does work with passing grade, but you have to set it manually in the gradebook. There is not a specific 'require passing grade' the way quiz or other modules have within settings, though. I've been requiring a passing grade this way for course and activity settings for years...

ResponsesInList.Title: Users can only book one session per face-to-face activity
ResponsesInList.Text: Is there a way to change this setting? I have students who need to book different facetoface sessions throughout the week and they need to pick more than one session instead of creating another whole face to face activity. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users can only book one session per face-to-face activity

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users can only book one session per face-to-face activity
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe face to face are meant to create several identical sessions for the student to choose the best that fits his/her schedule. Let's say you have instructor lead course "Course 101". That course you will offer it in 3 different "schedules". So you create 3 sessions for the same course at 2 different schedules. The student is supposed to attend just one. The most suitable for his/her schedule. I hope that clarifies.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Users can only book one session per face-to-face activity
ResponsesInList.Text: If you give the student (fully attended, no show, etc) credit for attending, it opens it up for sign up again. It only blocks if there is an open un-graded session.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can I turn off all notifictions in Face-to-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I am setting up some classroom events using this plugin, but many of our students do not access their email and would find the notifications and reminders bothersome. For sessions in the past, the plugin has the logic to turn off the reminders and displays session over on the course activity. Then of course there is most hoping that administrators (instructors) would have a easy way of marking the attendance for all enrolled (select all) and allowing them to select the date of the event vs the current date. Instructors/administrators often do not receive the attendance roster on the same day as the event. Kind Regards, Shirley

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I turn off all notifictions in Face-to-Face?
ResponsesInList.Text: I doubt it.  If you manually register (and then properly enroll, sense manual registration may add people to the course with no role), you can check the 'don't send email' box but I have never seen a way to block it if people sign themselves up. They can choose whether to get one or two emails but not to shut off email entirely. There is no native way to take attendance for everyone--at a previous job one of my techy coworkers wrote a script to add a link to the options which opened a page where you could enter an id number for each attendee and then submit in bulk.  It would also manually enroll people who showed up without signing up.  It was pretty slick.  But it did require an ID number. Our staff had a badge with an embedded code for their ID so they could swipe into the job sites...his code added something that with a USB swiper would read the id and made it super fast. Unfortunately, I don't have that code.  I thought he posted it for the community many years ago but have not been able to find it if he did...

ResponsesInList.Title: Importing data into Face to Face format from old LMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Howdy, Is there a way of importing data from and existing Learning Management System into a face to face format in Moodle for historical records. Moving forward in Moodle, the structure we have set is: 1. within a course there are multiple topics (doing different things), 2. in one of the Topics of a Course there are multiple Face to Face activities (1 for each state  the course is presented in 3. In each fact to Face activity there are multiple sessions which are run in each State We want to be able to import all the historical classes into the session within each state activity of face to face. We have tried it, and each imported class becomes its own course with blank topics in them. this then makes it hard as there becomes so many courses, and a mess. some of these courses prerequisites for future course, and instead of just making the prerequisite for 1 course, we will have to create it for every course (Too many) Please Help, I am a novice at this and the person which was assisting (which was more experienced) is no longer working for our company.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Importing data into Face to Face format from old LMS
ResponsesInList.Text: Dave, There isn't a straightforward way to do that in Moodle. You'd have to create the course shells and then manually import the data and mark the session attendance again for each one. There isn't anything out there for Moodle, at this moment, that will do this automatically. There are options in Totara though. Jeremy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
ResponsesInList.Text: Shirley, You can track past events using Face-to-face; however, the completion in Moodle will use the current date. Jeremy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past

Cheers Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: I would like a print attendance register option
ResponsesInList.Text: I've created an sql report and used a template, which does the job but includes people who cancel. The report shows everyone with a 50 in facetoface_signups_status.statuscode, and hides everyone with a 10. Them problem is everyone gets a 50 and then a 10 when cancels, so everyone shows up regardless. Any other solutions are welcome.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: I would like a print attendance register option
ResponsesInList.Text: There is an additional entry called superceded - if you only show those with 0 in this table, it will filter out those who have cancelled. I did think the status code was 70 though, not 50? I use a similar thing - config report below. Note - discountcode I use to produce a blank cell for the signature - we don't use discount code. select c.shortname, f.name AS SessionName, DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fsd.timestart),'%e %M %Y')  AS 'Date', DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fsd.timestart),'%h:%i %p') AS 'Time', u.username AS 'Payroll Number',  CONCAT(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) AS Name, fs.discountcode AS Signature from prefix_user AS u INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_signups as fs on u.id=fs.userid INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_sessions_dates as fsd on fs.sessionid=fsd.sessionid INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_sessions AS fse

ResponsesInList.Title: Report on which enrolled students have not signed up to a F2F session
ResponsesInList.Text: I was wondering if there's any kind of report I can run to tell me which enrolled students on a course are yet to sign up to any of the sessions available for a mandatory F2F activity?  I'd like to send a chaser email to all enrolees who are yet to sign up to a session. Thanks Emily

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Report on which enrolled students have not signed up to a F2F session
ResponsesInList.Text: It has to be done via SQL . You basically need to pull the enrolled users, and then exclude those booked/attended in your facetoface session. It would be something like this: SELECT u.id, u.username, u.firstname, u.lastname, u.email FROM mdl_role_assignments ra JOIN mdl_user u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN mdl_role r ON r.id = ra.roleid JOIN mdl_context cxt ON cxt.id = ra.contextid JOIN mdl_course c ON c.id = cxt.instanceid WHERE ra.userid = u.id AND ra.contextid = cxt.id AND cxt.contextlevel =50 AND cxt.instanceid = c.id The nested SELECT could probably use less joins (the session date table is complete unnecessary in this case, for example), I simply grabbed it from another query I had saved.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Matteo, We currently assume that the server timezone is the same as the user timezone. It would be good to remove that assumption. If you wanted to change this, have a look at all uses of "userdate()" in /mod/facetoface/lib.php The optional third parameter to userdate() is the timezone. For each user we send an email to, we should use his/her own timezone. Let me know if you get somewhere with this. I'd be happy to get this fixed. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time in reminder emails is not correct.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Time in reminder emails is not correct.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Matteo, I made i small modifcation to the code, because the localserver timezone was hardcoded. If you want to obtain it dinamically you can use a function to calculate the delta between the local time and UTC . So the code should look like this : $timezonul=$USER->timezone; ( or $timezonul=$user->timezone) if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()>=0) ) { $timezonul = "+".tzdelta() ;} else if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()<0)) {$timezonul = tzdelta();} function tzdelta ( $iTime = 0 ) { if ( 0 == $iTime ) { $iTime = time(); } $ar = localtime ( $iTime ); $ar[5] += 1900; $ar[4]++; $iTztime = gmmktime ( $ar[2], $ar[1], $ar[0], $ar[4], $ar[3], $ar[5], $ar[8] ); return ( $iTztime - $iTime ) /3600; } Now you can elimnate also the + sign after the UTC string and so you will have corect data even for servers with localtime bellow 0 UTC . Please test it and tell me if it works for you. Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Issues vs Discussions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, As you may be aware this plugin is sometimes supported and sometimes not. There are a few reasons for this and I am trying to rectify some of those as I go through things and sorry for the delays. One problem that the community of users can help me with is the way in which issues are being reported. At the moment there are many different threads being opened - here, in the plugin directory feedback, github, private messages to me etc - sometimes reporting the same issue or something that might be resolved within a different version. This means that it is difficult to track the exact issues and clearly identify where and when things should be corrected and to let the community know of updated code. I have switched off bug reporting on the github directory itself in the hopes that the Moodle tracker itself becomes the only place for issues to be reported. I'd like to also build a roadmap for coming versions and feature improvements so having all the issues in one place will really help this plan moving forward. There have been, since I took over maintenance, a few things I'd like to add and alter but first I need to get the current code into a consistent state. If you experience a issue please first check the tracker to see if there is an item already reporting this which you can add to and/or vote on and if not then please create a new one. The forums and plugin comments should ideally be used only for questions regarding general support such as configuration questions, suggestions for features and their related discussions and general use or feedback of the module. I will not be able to support bugs reported in these locations. In the meantime, thank you for your patience, Stacey

ResponsesInList.Title: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: I have recently come across an interesting question and would love some feedback... We use the Face-to-face activity to allow learners to sign up for in person sessions and we also use prerequisites to track learner progress, etc. If we have multiple sessions available for one Face-to-face activity and the requirement for the course completion is a grade (attendance) in the face-to-face activity does it effect the course completion if they only sign up for one session? Or for the course completion to work properly with the prerequisities would they have to sign up for each session? Sorry if that is really confusing... Thank you in advance for your time and/or ideas!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: It is my understanding that a user CANNOT sign up for more than one session in the same face to face activity. That is a problem for us, but in your case might be desirable. You can test this by setting up more than one session for a face to face and see if the same student can sign up to multiple sessions. To accomplish this in our setting we have to set up separate face to face activities , each with its own sessions. Your bigger problem might be that F2F counts any attendance status (Fully attended, partially attended, no show) as being a valid completion. This is also a problem for us but I have not had time to look into the solution that the followup message to this thread offers: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=225026

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mia, Hmm - I think you and I seem to face the same challenges. My other answer to the above is - I have remmed out the lines that have partially attended or no show - if someone doesn't show, the facilitator actually removes them from the session. This way, they have to get a "Attended" to get a course completion. Obviously this may not work for everyone. Incidently, I have a cancellation report, which picks out students that have cancelled sessions and why, and when the person cancelling the session is not the student, puts it as a "No Show" Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: yes I always read your face to face posts and it seems like we do have some of the same issues. Thanks for the info about the partially attended or no show -- we want to record no shows, though. We are working on a custom addition to Face to Face that adds another layer of approval after the manager approval so that an account number can be entered by a fund manager. In addition, the approval links that take the approvers to their approvals filter the approvals on the page so that only their own approvals show, AND the approver does not need the permission to the entire Attendees page if they use the link to access the approvals page. I hope that we can eventually get this code and some other code we are customizing in F2F incorporated into the main F2F module. Will tell more as it develops in case others are interested.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I was searching for something completely different in Google, and this came up, which reminded me, I finally after 18 months found the root cause of the issue. By default, Moodle sets the default grade to pass as 0 (who knows why...) Once you change this default to 100, then any F2F activity created will have the no show, partial attendence etc marked as failed, rather than passed. I then also did a cheeky back end database to all F2F sessions to have the gradetopass setting set to 100. I hope this helps someone else. Cheers Peter

Thank you for your time and have a wonderful day!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Piersante Once you setup Face2face every user will need to go into their individual user profile and enter an email address of their manager or a person who will approve their enrolment.  This is a must. The Face2face add-on uses a two-tier approval process. The first tier is the manager. Once the user sets their managers email address, they can go to a course and enrol. Upon their enrolment an email will be sent to their manager. The email will contacin a link for the manager to login and approve the enrolment. Once the manager has approved the enrolment, an email will be sent to the course coordinator /s. The course cordinator is anyone who has been given teacher or manager role within the course. You need to set these roles for every course. To approve the enrolment as a course coordinator, the person who has been allocated teacher or manager role for the course will log in and go to Site pages (left had side under home) and select Course coordinator approval. This is where the lis of students who have been approved to attend will show up for the course coordintor to approve to attend the course. Once the course coordinator approves the student, this completes the process. Please remember to set your course to use the Face2face add-on. Go to the course and under Users > Enrollment methods select Enrol Approval and move that to the top of the list (select the blue arrow). I normall delete the "Self enrolment (student)" if that is on the list. If it is grey out you dont need to worry. Manaul enrolments is normally at the bottom when using the Face2face add-on. You now need to set up your Face2face add-on by adding an activity. Go into the course, make sure editing is on and on the first topic you need to add a activity. Find the Face-to-face activity and select Add. You must add a name. I suggest you type in the name of the course as this will show up on the 2 emails as part of the enrolment process. You must check the following boxes: Approval required. Send notice to manager (confirmation message) Send notice to manager (Reminder message) Send notice to manager (Cancellation message) Click on Save and return to course Get a normal user with only student role to find the course and see is it asks you to enrol and put a justification in. Hope this helps Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager

Not only this was not clear from the documentation, but it is cumbersome, as the default manager address is only inherited by new (or updated) users. I had to open and save all the students profiles one by one, to let them to get it (I suspect that I could have added the email address to the data user field table directly in the database , but I didn't dare to try). I find it also illogical, as the manager would usually belong to the activity rather than to the students (students might have different facetoface activities , each with a different manager), so one would expect it to be defined in the session properties, rather than globally. Nevertheless, thanks to your note I was qickly able to put the module at work and I find it wonderful and very flexible. I now have one more question: the confirmation email has fields for venue, room and location, which in my case are empty. Where do you set them? thanks, piersante

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: "I now have one more question: the confirmation email has fields for venue, room and location, which in my case are empty. Where do you set them?" They are set as added custom fields in the settings for the face to face plugin: Site administration / Plugins / Activity modules / Face To Face Section - Custom Session Fields Create a new field for each of the 3 fields Note: I think the  short names need to be 'venue', 'location',  'room' - all lowercase. You can use capitals in the Name field.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Where should the manager's email address field be created, and what is its short name? TIA John

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: You are currently not assigned to a manager
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi John To create the manager's email address field : Go to: 1. Site administration  / ► Users/ ► Accounts/ ► User profile fields 2. When there select   "create new profile field” 3. Complete the settings for your new field: Common Settings: - Short name (must be unique): managersemail - Name: whatevername - Description: whatever ..... - Various Parameters : ... Specific Settings - Default value etc When done Click on Save Changes So the managers email must be created in the User Profile under Site administration. The shortname  = managersemail. Hope this is helpfull.

The issue is within the backup_facetoface_stepslib.php - line 128 $session_data_element->set_source_table('facetoface_session_data', array('sessionid' => backup::VAR_PARENTID)); which does the back up of the data only if user data is selected. ResponsesInList.Title: Upgrading facetoface from 2007091300 to 2013010400
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm in the process of upgrading from Moodle 1.9.19 to 2.2.6 (I realise these are ageing versions with limited-to-no support) which involved upgrading facetoface from 2007091300 to 2013010400 and there were multiple issues. To resolve these I had to make changes to mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php, I've attached the patch to this post. To summarise the issues: $dbman->add_field(), create_table() and drop_field() appears to return void so don't assign this to $result. (This appears to be already known: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=217299 ). $OUTPUT->notification() is an empty object, add $OUTPUT to the list of globals at the start of xmldb_facetoface_upgrade(). Property $DB->debug isn't accessible (protected) so remove these. The second parameter for $DB->get_records() should be either null or an array. The field list for $DB->get_records() should be in the fourth parameter. Unless of course there's something very wrong with my installation. All the best, Leon

ResponsesInList.Title: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois I noticed in the options for the f2f module that you can send a wait list message. How do I setup a wait listed f2f session? Currently when I create a session and fill the booking it removes it from the available sessions list and tells me the booking is full. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, What we mean by wait-listed session is slightly different than what you have in mind I think. A 'wait-listed session' in the Face-to-face module is a session for which no date is currently set. Users can then register their interest in attending a Face-to-face course even if it's not offered at this time. There is no way at this time to "exceed" the capacity of a given session but this can be approximated by adding a second session without a date on which users can sign-up if the other one is full.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois Thank you for the clarification. So if a user signs up for a 'wait-listed session' as you have described above what happens if a booking opens up in a non-wait-listed session? Can users be moved automatically from a wait-listed session to a non-wait-listed session? What would the process be in this case? Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: No, at the moment, the two sessions (the scheduled one and the wait-listed one) are completely separate. Thus the wait-list cannot be used to fill the spots of the people who cancel, unless the instructor manually adds them, or if they come back to the page by chance and see that a spot has freed up. It would probably be a good idea to implement something like that though. I'd have to think about how to do this while keeping the UI as simple as possible. If you have any ideas, I suggest that you create a new ticket in the tracker and describe how you see it working. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Wait listed sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply. I have added CONTRIB-408 to the tracker. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature?
ResponsesInList.Text: OK - combining F2F with Activity Tracker, and we came across a curious instance where if a student was marked as a No Show in the Face to Face session, they were showing as successully completed the module. Of course, as I have customised both, I went back to basics to find it, and here is what I found. Regardless of the result of the Face to Face session, (Fully attended, partially attended, no show) Face to Face still injects a completion status of 1 into the table mdl_course_modules_completion . (Note - if course completion is set to require 100% to pass, this is not an issue - just reporting through Activity Tracker, which utilises the completionstatus flag in mdl_course_modules_completion ) Now one could argue either way for this - that they technically have completed the module, however got a pass mark of 0%, or they have not completed the module because they didn't turn up. Myself - I argue the second option - but interesting to see other thoughts out there. Any one with thoughts? Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: Actually, after a bit more work and investigating - it is not the F2F as such. By default with course completion, any grade is enough to complete. If you then go into grades, Grade Administration->Categories and items->Full View , then set the "Grade to Pass" to be higher than 0.(probably 100)  This then injects a 2 for a pass, or a 3 for a fail into the mdl_course_modules_completion module, and then need to modify the Activity Tracking to look for just a 1 or a 2, not anything that is inserted into the field. Simple when you know how????? Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: We don't make use of partial attendance or no show.  If we did use no show, I would NOT want it to indicate that the activity has been completed under Completion Tracking. Thanks for sharing your workaround.  Looks a bit complicated to me though.  I think it'll be easier for us if I just remove the option to select partial attendance or no show to prevent teachers from selecting those options. If we were to use "No show" on our system, I would want it to allow users to re-book another session. As it is now, students can only book one session of a Face-to-face activity.  If they're not able to attend the session for whatever reason, how do I let them book another time instead.  I'm still not so sure how to handle this properly.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: This did end up complex for us, and screwed with a few other things. So - in the back end, I remmed out the No Show and Partially Completed so the only thing that can be completed is Attended. If the student is a No Show, then the facilitator removes them from the session. In this way, they are not marked as completed, but they are also not prevented from booking into another session. I also have a report that displays reasons for cancelled sessions, and if the user that cancels the session isn't the student, then it reports as a no show. I hope that makes sense. Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, it does make sense and it helps.  Thanks! I wish the teacher/facilitator didn't have to manually remove the no shows but I guess it needs to be done.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature? - SOLVED
ResponsesInList.Text: Peter, Thank you for sharing the information regarding this bug and your workaround. May I ask what ended up happening with the workaround? Which issues did you run into? In our case, we want to use the functionality of "No Shows" and "Partially Completed", but of course it has to function correctly. Thank you for sharing!

ResponsesInList.Title: F2F - Manager Approval Issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alastair , I found an interesting bug today.... A F2F course requires manager approval, and a user signs up to the course. An email is sent to the manager, and the student - all is good. However, the student is not given an indication on the screen that they are waitlisted, so they can sign in again. The big gotcha, is once they sign in a second time, even once they are approved and the status as an admin says booked, the end user still has the status as being able to sign up. They will NEVER see on their screen that they are booked in - they will always get the option to sign up. Of course, if they sign up again AFTER they are approved, then they get un-booked and put as waiting for approval, and the whole cycle starts again. Any thoughts? This is latest iteration of F2F and moodle 2.4.3+ (Dated this week) Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: F2F - Manager Approval Issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Actually, ignore this - I found the issue. (My meddling, not yours - my apologies) Ended up because I removed the no show (due to other reasons) by remming the line define('MDL_F2F_STATUS_NO_SHOW',            80); it inadvertantly caused an issue further down, where it would not ever show the person as having been booked in to attend the session. Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: F2F Report bug
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alastair, We had our big launch, and of course a few days before had staff madly adding Face to Face sessions (a few hundred) We were going through the logs and kept finding these seamlessly random students have added a F2F session - needless to say we were incredibly confused. After some chasing, we have found that F2F was injecting into the mdl_log database , and for some reason using the activityid as the userid - hence why we were getting random students in the log... (Including students that had never logged in) I found that line 209 in sessions.php seems to be the culprit add_to_log($course->id, 'facetoface', 'added session', 'facetoface', 'sessions.php?f='.$facetoface->id, $facetoface->id, $cm->id); My suggested correction is add_to_log($course->id, 'facetoface', 'added session',  'sessions.php?f='.$facetoface->id, $facetoface->id, $cm->id); Let me know if you want me to raise a tracker for this? (I haven't done one before.... could be interesting) Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings! I have been happily using a 1.9 version of moodle with face-to-face for about 4 years, and decided to attempt an upgrade to v2.3.   As per the upgrade documentation, that required going to v2.2 first. Unfortunately, the upgrade failed for the Face-to-Face module, with this error: mod_facetoface Field "shortname" already exists Stack trace: * line 573 of /lib/ddl/database_manager.php: ddl_exception thrown * line 141 of /mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php: call to database_manager->add_field() * line 540 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to xmldb_facetoface_upgrade() * line 271 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to upgrade_plugins_modules() * line 1437 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to upgrade_plugins() * line 269 of /admin/index.php: call to upgrade_noncore() I removed the module and continued with the upgrade, which succeeded, and then attempted to add the face-to-face module again, but continue to get the same error. Is there a way to recover from this? The " Server Checks" page says that everything is ok.  I'm running PHP ver 5.3.8 and mysql ver 5.1.65.14.0.    I installed moodle ver 2.2.6 (planning to then upgrade to ver 2.3). Thanks for any assistance. -- Steve Messinger

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Steve, You should be able to fix this problem by changing the following line in mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php about line 141: $result = $result && $dbman->add_field($table, $field1); needs to be changed to if (!$dbman->field_exists($table, $field)) { $dbman->add_field($table, $field1); } Hopefully after that has been changed the upgrade will work without breaking. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alastair, 1st thank you for your time.  I'm also getting the same error when trying to upgrade to facetoface 2.2+. I tried the code change you're recommending above but got a different error message.  Here it is.. mod_facetoface Notice: Undefined variable: field in /home/cooptraining/dev/mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php on line 141 Fatal error: Call to a member function getName() on a non-object in /home/cooptraining/dev/lib/ddl/database_manager.php on line 153 Version I'm using: Moodle 2.2.6 (Build: 20121112) My SQL : 5.0.92-log PHP: 5.3.18 Thanks, Pierre

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Pierre, Sorry it took so long to reply. I noticed a problem with the post I put up with the fix. On the first line where is says "$field" it should be "$field1". Hopefully once that is done it should work ok. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: facetoface 1.9.6 and multiple sessions
ResponsesInList.Text: A. Do you want each Manager to book and attend each Monday session throughout 2013? OR B. Do you want them to book individual sessions because you can not accomodate everyone each Monday? If A, then create one activity with one session containing multiple dates (every Monday) and have them book that event.; If B and its first come first serve, then you would have to create an activity for each Monday session throughout the year.  Again, you will find some discussion on signing up for multiple sessions in the same activity, but I'm not sure that anyone has enabled this in a recent release with custom code.  It's definitely not doable with the current release. Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: Our service provided indicated that when they tested Face-to-Face Module they identified a major security risk (hole) and alerted us that Face-to-Face Module was not safe to run/install.  We are running Moodle 1.9.11.  Could anyone shed some light on this?  Is there a fix?  This module does exactly what we need and we would like to use it.  Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Glen, The feed back from your hosting provider which i have also received from them is as follows; "editattendees.php uses PARAM_RAW for a search string used to search the database . This is a serious SQL injection vulnerability. (this issue also exists in the 1.9 version". i have no idea how potentially serious this is, but do know that other hosting providers don't seem to be so concerned about it. Jenna

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Glen and Jenna, Although PARAM_RAW is used, the data is still escaped by Moodle so will not result in an SQL injection vulnerability, nor is the search string stored or displayed to the user so will not result in a XSS vulnerability either. In short this does not appear to be exploitable, however the user of PARAM_RAW is still less than ideal so I have updated the f2f module to use a more restrictive param type - this should keep your hosting company happy. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
ResponsesInList.Text: The latest code in the git repo at https://github.com/totara/facetoface-1.9 has the fix in. I'll get a packaged release out tomorrow that will include this patch. Cheers, Alastair

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Attendance Does Not Save
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joe, The first two things I would do to try to figure out what is happening is to turn on full debugging in Moodle: 1- Set " Server | Debugging | Debug messages" to "Developer" 2- Set "Server | Debugging | Display debug messages" to "Yes" Then have a look at the error log of your webserver. For example, on a Debian system running Apache , that's /var/log/apache2/error_log Also, another thing to check would be your version of PHP. Are you running PHP4 or PHP5? (you can find that from "Server | PHP info"

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Cant Edit words or phrases
ResponsesInList.Text: If editing php files does not seem to take effect the reason is often in php eaccelerator (enabled) which keeps the old files in a sort of server cache. Check if your php.ini has eaccelerator enabled with line eaccelerator.enable = "1" You can change that to eaccelerator.enable = "0" and restart the server...

ResponsesInList.Title: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Face-to-face will be great for our institution but one issue is the Moodle calandar entry is SITE WIDE. This is not good for us. We need the calandar entry to be Course wide, as we have many different departments / courses using our single install of moodle. As it is, awards, programmes and courses will all have calendar entrys that do not apply to them. Does anyone have a soloution to this? We use Moodle 1.9.7 Many Thanks John

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: I'll add +1 to this and have raised a bug report in the tracker for this specific issue if you'd like to vote - http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-2850 If events are course based they must be targeted at individuals on that course, not displayed on the site-wide calendar where they just confuse everyone else. Thanks, Gordon.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: This isn't a bug  - you can disable this behavior under the Face-to-face options by unchecking "Show on the calendar". If you want it to show up on the course calendar you can either add it manually or wait for people to sign up and then it will appear on their own calendars.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: I disagree - perhaps it's terminology semantics about what a bug is. Would you be happier if it was called a usability flaw? I have tutors starting to use this actively so the global calendar is getting overwhelmed with course specific content. The default setting is to show on calendar, and if you're co-ordinating training sessions that sounds like the right thing to do. The tick box option can't be disabled by the administrator without hacking the code. If the calendar populated was the course one instead of the site calendar it wouldn't be an issue. After testing this I've also found that if someone saves the event with those default settings then edits to uncheck the calendar box the events remain visible in the global calendar (I'd call that a bug too).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: I still wouldn't call this behavior a bug. This is the exact behavior that plenty of people need, so a whole sale change to course specific context would be a regression for us. I see you added this request to the tracker, but I disagree with your characterization. Instead, a new feature request to add the ability to choose the context would more appropriate. I'd also say that the other two complaints are best served by feature requests as neither are technically a bug. A bug is when something doesn't function the way it was intended, in this case each function behaves exactly the way it was designed and are perfectly usable for many scenarios. However, I would agree that adding a way to set the global default for whether an event appears on the calendar or not and an easy way to remove events from the calendar would be useful new features.

ResponsesInList.Title: Updated invite not sent when a F2F is updated
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there -  I noticed today that an updated invite is not sent to attendees when I update the time or date of a face-to-face event. This creates a problem! How do you handle updating an f2f event? Is the best practice to cancel the original event instead and create a new one? Wouldn't the user then have to delete the old event from their calendar? Your tips and ideas are appreciate! Thanks, Kymm

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Updated invite not sent when a F2F is updated
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a workaround I use, the order of actions is important: Export the participants' list for the session (to excel for instance) Use add/remove participants for the session to remove all participants (this send the cancellation emails for the previous session dates) Change the session dates to the new ones Use add/remove participants to add participants 1 by 1 - this sends the new updated invitations to them. I use the exported list form step 1 to search the participants that were already signed up. Regards, Amir

ResponsesInList.Title: Activity Locking vs Using a Child Course
ResponsesInList.Text: Our courses consist of blended learning. Right now we have two moodle courses set up for each course. One course is for the live instruction portion for which we use face to face. The second is for the online learning content where we have uploaded scorm content. The course is sequential meaning that the online content does not become available until the user completes the live instruction course. I tried using Activity Locking (I'm don't fully understand all of its features yet) but the problems I have are two fold: 1 - We run the same live instruction course in dozens of cities. Each instance/session is its own face-to-face and a user need only attend one face to face session to be eligible for the online content. It seems as if the activity lock is an all or nothing proposition, I can't set it to say that any face-to-face attendance would qualify to unlock the online learning content. 2 - The online learning content is accessible for 60 days from the face-to-face/live session attendance. Any ideas on how to control this? Right now we do this manually. Thank you

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activity Locking vs Using a Child Course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jon. As for issue one if you open just one face-to-face activity but then open different sessions for that activity (these can be on different times and in different locations) this should solve your problem. Actually, I think this should be the correct use of this activity. The only times we open more than one face-to-face activity, is when there is a significant difference between the two - e.g. begineer vs. advanced intructor-led training. I have an idea concerning issue 2. If you use groups and groupings, you can then put the online content (SCORM) to be visible only to a specific grouping , and then define the availability of this resource/activity according to when the group had the training. So, if you put copies of the SCORM activity in the course, only the group members would see it according to the availability setting set within the actvity. Using groups/groupings would also prove valuable to track the grades and completion of activities per group. You can distribute the people in the groups or perhaps better yet - avoiding manual work - give each group a unique key for course enrolment and they are then automatically put into their group. One more thing - is there a specific reason you put the online and face-to-face activities in different courses? Wouldn't it be easier for learners if you put it in the same course - say in topic 1 and topic 2? Best of luck. Ask more if I was not clear.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Confirmation emails : how to delay & trigger the sending ?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Sandrine, If you use the teacher view (from the attendees list) to add/remove students to a Face-to-face session, then you can click the optional checkbox which allows you to suppress the email notifications before you add/remove attendees. That way if you need to add a bunch of people tentatively, you can click the checkbox and they won't hear about it under the reminder email comes in (which you can configure in the activity settings). If you need to remove them from the course before the reminder is sent out, then you can do so from the same page. As long as you click the checkbox before removing them, they will not receive an email. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Attendence linked to online course enrollment
ResponsesInList.Text: Let me start off by explaining the situation. We use Moodle to train technicians around the world but one state requires us to provide face-to-face classes for the technician's first training. After they have taken the face-to-face class they are able to renew their training by taking a course online. (Our training certificates expire every 2 years) The problem is setting up a course just for that particular state that has enrollment limited to those technicians that have already taken a face-to-face class. Some changes would probably need to be made to the core Moodle files as well as the face-to-face code but I would love to have the face-to-face attendence be linked to the online course enrolment somehow. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Duration variable issue
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Marc, The duration field is actually separate from the start and end time. This is done because some sessions can be over multiple days. When adding/editing a session, the number that is entered is in hours with fractional numbers allowed (see the contextual help next to that field). Then it is stored in the database as a number of minutes. Finally, it's displayed to users (on the signup page for example) in a nicer human-readable way: 1 hour 30 minutes. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Making an individual session unavailable for booking
ResponsesInList.Text: All I needed a way to make an individual session unavailable for booking.  Basically the instructor wanted to add students to specific sessions manually without the student signing up themselves.  To do this I changed the code in face-to-face/lib.php as shown below: // Only numbers allowed here $session->capacity = preg_replace('/[^\d]/', '', $session->capacity); $MAX_CAPACITY = 100000; if ($session->capacity < 0) { //changed from a 1 to a 0 to allow session capacity to be set to 0 so sessions can be closed. $session->capacity = 1; } elseif ($session->capacity > $MAX_CAPACITY) { $session->capacity = $MAX_CAPACITY; } The scenario is this:  The instructor has a session that has 25 seats, but 15 of those seats need to be held for a specific department.  Once those 15 seats are filled then the instructor opens the session for anyone else that wants to register.  Setting the capacity to 0 effectively allows the session to be created but makes the session unavailable for students to book.  The instructor(s) adds the 15 students from the department and then two weeks before class starts they change the capacity to the actual capacity of the class opening up the remaining seats to whoever wants to book it. I hope I have explained this well.  In my testing it seems to be working beautifully, I just wonder if I am breaking something else by doing this.  ANy thoughts of comments? Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making an individual session unavailable for booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, I like your solution, I don't think it's gonna break anything. The only thing that you changed is the "< 1" to a "< 0" ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making an individual session unavailable for booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois That is the only change that I made. I wonder if there might be a better way to handle this scenario. Of course better usually means more complicated. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A couple of problems I have noticed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, The first one is by design. This is to allow a teacher to override the limit and sign up more students if they want to. Please file a bug though if it causes any problems (e.g. display problems). The second issue is configurable in the site-wide activity settings. Some mail readers (e.g. GroupWise) turn iCal attachments into a calendar item and make the email disappear completely. These people will need to enable the dual-email option if they want their staff to be able to read the confirmation email. As for the HTML editor, it would be possible to do this, but it hasn't been implemented yet. It is on our TODO list, it simply hasn't been a priority yet. Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A couple of problems I have noticed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, Sorry, I lied, the option isn't in the site-wide settings. It's per-user at the time of signup: - "email & iCal": you get two emails - "iCal only": you get a single email with an iCal attachment - "email only": a single email without attachments As for the HTML editor, if you search for "htmlbody" and "posthtml" in lib.php, that should be a good start. I would try to keep the plain text version in there as well for those people who can't get HTML emails (e.g. corporate policy). Feel free to share the good you have, this is definitely something that I'd like to see in the Face-to-face module. Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Face-to-face 1.4.0 released!
ResponsesInList.Text: A new version of the Face-to-face module has been released. It is highly recommended that you upgrade to it since it includes some security fixes . New features in this release: There is now a list of user cancellations on the attendance page. The Participants report shows the expected data. User-level activity reports ("Outline" and "Complete" reports) are also populated. Other noteworthy improvements: The module now uses a custom field on the user profile page for the manager's email address instead of the MSN field. The attendance data is now stored in the gradebook. Important bug fixes: The session key is now checked in all user forms. The take attendance page now displays the actual attendance and allows teachers to untick checkboxes. iCalendar appointments are no longer sent for wait-listed sessions. Remove internationalisation from log entries. Default email messages are no longer set in the site-wide settings page, they should simply be overridden in the language pack. Francois, Catalyst IT

ResponsesInList.Text: I have added a "Suppress email notifications" checkbox to the interface. It's now in CVS . Cheers, Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Face-to-face 1.2.0 released!
ResponsesInList.Text: A new and improved version of the Face-to-face module is now ready to be downloaded: Download latest version It includes the following new features: Teachers can now sign users up for a session, even after the fact. Open Document Format support when downloading attendance Dutch translation by Peter-Anne Wissema But perhaps more importantly, it fixes a number of bugs, including these: Always mark reminders as sent, even when the email to the manager failed. Fix the default permissions to fix problems where a user is both student and teacher. Add an empty db/upgrade.php to fix upgrade problems on Moodle 1.9 Respect the system's date and currency format when displaying dates and costs. More details are available in the change log . As usual, please report bugs in the tracker or ask for help in this forum. Francois, Catalyst IT

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Integration with Course Page
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Scott, Sorry for the late reply. What do you mean exactly by "integrating this as a course format"? Do you mean integrating it so that Moodle displays the information on the course page by default? Francois

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Integration with Course Page
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois Thanks for getting back to me. Yes, my original thought was to be able to display the information as part of the course summary so that students would be able to sign up for a f2f session from the available courses page. Thinking about it further it seems that it would make more sense as an enrollment plug-in. Something that would allow the students to sign up for the session they want without having to first enroll in the course and then sign up. One of the things that is a bit inconvenient is the fact that students need to enroll in the course, then sign up for a session. I now have two course rosters that I need to manage, if the student wanted to un-enroll from the course they would first have to cancel the f2f session and then un-enroll. Does this make sense? I am not a developer by any means but I would be willing to invest sometime to take a stab at it if you can point me to the correct files and provide some advice. Scott Karren

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Integration with Course Page
ResponsesInList.Text: I think I see what you mean. At the moment, to approximate what you're describing, you'd have to have automatic enrolment and all of the Face-to-face activities in a course. I'm not sure exactly how I would implement what you're describing because it sounds like it would be putting a lot of interactivity into the course summary element. Perhaps a description of how your courses are organized and how they relate to the Face-to-face activities would help us figure out a way to support your workflow better.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Integration with Course Page
ResponsesInList.Text: Francois The majority of my courses at present are instructor led with complimentary materials online. I will have one class that I teach five different times throughout the next two months. Students will sign-up for one three hour session and then go online to download the materials needed for the class. Once class is completed they will go back online to complete the class assessment and evaluation. I could put the f2f activities in the first topic of a course and then all subsequent materials in other topics, but students still face the inconvenience of signing up twice for the course. What I kinda envision is that a student will select the course they want from the available courses list, the sessions sign-up screen will appear, the student will select the session they want to attend and then be taken to the course screen itself showing what session they are signed up for and have access to all materials. Again, I wonder if this would be something more suited as an enrollment plugin instead of an activity within a course? Let me know your thoughts or if you have additional questions. Scott Karren
